text.text: Guidelines for Overseas Students For Fall 2020 Final Term Examination

text: As an overseas student You must adhere to "Code of Conduct Outside of Pakistan" from the following link:

Overseas Exam Software and related materials have been made available for download. Please make sure to install latest exam application available on the link given below. You must follow the sequence of instructions given below for smooth and error free installation:
1. Download and install VUTES exam software from following link

.
2. Download and install only TeamViewer on workstation from following link:

.
Note: Install the TeamViewer software for Personal/Non-Commercial use.
3. Uninstall antivirus applications and disable windows firewall before the start of paper.
4. System default language MUST be English (United States). It can be set from Control Panel -> Region and Language -> Format
5. No proxy software/remote control software (except TeamViewer) should be installed or configured on the machine (like ultra-surf, hotspot shield, LogMeIn etc.).
6. Disable Internet Explorer Proxy settings. It can be disabled from Internet Options -> Connections -> LAN Settings and uncheck proxy server settings.
7. Do not configure external webcam to any other application (like MSN, Yahoo, Skype etc.); otherwise exam application will not detect the external webcam.
8. After installation, you must go through the “User Manual” for Know-How to attempt your paper.
9. An icon will be visible on your desktop after installation of VUTES exam application. Please double click the icon to run the demo test.
You may test your installation by joining any of the following sessions till February 25, 2021 during the specified session timings as mentioned below:

text.text:
Session 1:      07:30 A.M to 09:00 A.M (PST)
Session 2:      09:30 A.M to 11:00 A.M (PST)
Session 3:      11:30 A.M to 01:00 P.M (PST)
Session 4:      02:30 P.M to 04:00 P.M (PST)
Session 5:      04:30 P.M to 06:00 P.M (PST)
Session 6:      06:30 P.M to 08:00 P.M (PST)

text: Please use your student ID as login and password for login into the exam application to check demo test. For example,

text.text:
Student ID: BC19020XXXX (Your student ID)
Password: BC19020XXXX (Your student ID)

text: After completing the demo test, you must confirm your installation status by clicking the link “Click here to confirm your installation status” given on
Note: There are no invigilators present during the demo sessions, so no need to reply the messages during demo. You can send us your feedback at

"during demo sessions for support.

UAN: +9242111880880 Ext: 352
Direct:

Due Date: 2021-02-13

You can select any topic from the list for Presentation.

1.   Do running time of Algorithm effects its efficiency?
2.   Fundamental Data Structures Used in Algorithms.
3.   Sorting Algorithms and their efficiency, considering time complexity.
4.   Searching Algorithms and their efficiency, considering time complexity.
5.   Graph Representation VS Tree Representation

See these messages for submission format and guidelines.

text.text: AI001 - Introduction to AI for IT and Non-IT Professionals

text:
Present an NP-Complete problem which is not already discussed in the video lectures.

See these messages for submission format and guidelines.

The University has unblocked LMS Accounts of the students in order to facilitate them in making date sheet for Fall'2020 (Final-Term) Exams and carry out other academic activities. However, It is advised to

text.text: clear outstanding dues at the earliest

text:
to avoid blocking after the examination. 

Students with blocked accounts will not be able to view Final-term result for Fall'2020 semester and make course selection for Spring'2021 semester.

messages.text:
Inside the mind of a master procrastinator
Tim Urban - Ted Talk

This video is posted on this channel to help students understand why they keep postponing their assignments and exam preparations till the last moment.
